author_blurb.en: Translated for SuttaCentral by Bhikkhu Sujato, 2018. Dedicated to the public domain via Creative Commons Zero (CC0). You are encouraged to copy, reproduce, adapt, alter, or otherwise make use of this translation in any way you wish. Attribution is appreciated but not legally required.

segments.en: Linked Discourses 35
3. All
32. The Practice Conducive to Uprooting (2nd)
“Mendicants, I will teach you the practice that’s conducive to uprooting all identifying.
Listen …

segments.pli: Katamā ca sā, bhikkhave, sabbamaññitasamugghātasappāyā paṭipadā?
segments.en: And what is the practice that’s conducive to uprooting all identifying?
What do you think, mendicants?
Is the eye permanent or impermanent?”
“Impermanent, sir.”

segments.pli: “Yaṃ panāniccaṃ dukkhaṃ vā taṃ sukhaṃ vā”ti?
segments.en: “But if it’s impermanent, is it suffering or happiness?”
“Suffering, sir.”

segments.pli: “Yaṃ panāniccaṃ dukkhaṃ vipariṇāmadhammaṃ, kallaṃ nu taṃ samanupassituṃ:
segments.en: “But if it’s impermanent, suffering, and liable to fall apart, is it fit to be regarded thus:
‘This is mine, I am this, this is my self’?”
“No, sir.”
“Are sights …
eye consciousness …
eye contact …

segments.pli: “Yampidaṃ cakkhusamphassapaccayā uppajjati vedayitaṃ sukhaṃ vā dukkhaṃ vā adukkhamasukhaṃ vā tampi niccaṃ vā aniccaṃ vā”ti?
segments.en: The pleasant, painful, or neutral feeling that arises conditioned by eye contact: is that permanent or impermanent?”
“Impermanent, sir.”

segments.pli: “Yaṃ panāniccaṃ dukkhaṃ vā taṃ sukhaṃ vā”ti?
segments.en: “But if it’s impermanent, is it suffering or happiness?”
“Suffering, sir.”

segments.pli: “Yaṃ panāniccaṃ dukkhaṃ vipariṇāmadhammaṃ, kallaṃ nu taṃ samanupassituṃ:
segments.en: “But if it’s impermanent, suffering, and liable to fall apart, is it fit to be regarded thus:
‘This is mine, I am this, this is my self’?”
“No, sir.” …
“Is the ear … nose … tongue …

segments.pli: yampidaṃ jivhāsamphassapaccayā uppajjati vedayitaṃ sukhaṃ vā dukkhaṃ vā adukkhamasukhaṃ vā tampi niccaṃ vā aniccaṃ vā”ti?

segments.en: body … mind …

segments.pli: “Yampidaṃ manosamphassapaccayā uppajjati vedayitaṃ sukhaṃ vā dukkhaṃ vā adukkhamasukhaṃ vā tampi niccaṃ vā aniccaṃ vā”ti?
segments.en: The pleasant, painful, or neutral feeling that arises conditioned by mind contact: is that permanent or impermanent?”
“Impermanent, sir.”

segments.pli: “Yaṃ panāniccaṃ dukkhaṃ vā taṃ sukhaṃ vā”ti?
segments.en: “But if it’s impermanent, is it suffering or happiness?”
“Suffering, sir.”

segments.pli: “Yaṃ panāniccaṃ dukkhaṃ vipariṇāmadhammaṃ, kallaṃ nu taṃ samanupassituṃ:
segments.en: “But if it’s impermanent, suffering, and liable to fall apart, is it fit to be regarded thus:
‘This is mine, I am this, this is my self’?”
“No, sir.”

segments.pli: “Evaṃ passaṃ, bhikkhave, sutavā ariyasāvako cakkhusmimpi nibbindati, rūpesupi nibbindati, cakkhuviññāṇepi nibbindati, cakkhusamphassepi nibbindati.
segments.en: “Seeing this, a learned noble disciple grows disillusioned with the eye, sights, eye consciousness, and eye contact.

segments.pli: Yampidaṃ cakkhusamphassapaccayā uppajjati vedayitaṃ sukhaṃ vā dukkhaṃ vā adukkhamasukhaṃ vā tasmimpi nibbindati … pe …
segments.en: And they grow disillusioned with the painful, pleasant, or neutral feeling that arises conditioned by eye contact.

segments.pli: jivhāyapi nibbindati, rasesupi … pe … yampidaṃ jivhāsamphassapaccayā uppajjati vedayitaṃ sukhaṃ vā dukkhaṃ vā adukkhamasukhaṃ vā tasmimpi nibbindati … pe ….
segments.en: They grow disillusioned with the ear … nose … tongue … body …

segments.pli: Manasmimpi nibbindati, dhammesupi nibbindati, manoviññāṇepi nibbindati, manosamphassepi nibbindati.
segments.en: They grow disillusioned with the mind, thoughts, mind consciousness, and mind contact.

segments.pli: Yampidaṃ manosamphassapaccayā uppajjati vedayitaṃ sukhaṃ vā dukkhaṃ vā adukkhamasukhaṃ vā tasmimpi nibbindati.
segments.en: And they grow disillusioned with the painful, pleasant, or neutral feeling that arises conditioned by mind contact.

segments.pli: Nibbindaṃ virajjati; virāgā vimuccati; vimuttasmiṃ vimuttamiti ñāṇaṃ hoti.
segments.en: Being disillusioned, desire fades away. When desire fades away they’re freed. When they’re freed, they know they’re freed.

segments.pli: ‘Khīṇā jāti, vusitaṃ brahmacariyaṃ, kataṃ karaṇīyaṃ, nāparaṃ itthattāyā’ti pajānāti.
segments.en: They understand: ‘Rebirth is ended, the spiritual journey has been completed, what had to be done has been done, there is no return to any state of existence.’

segments.pli: Ayaṃ kho sā, bhikkhave, sabbamaññitasamugghātasappāyā paṭipadā”ti.
segments.en: This is the practice that’s conducive to uprooting all identifying.”

sections.title: “Mendicants, I will teach you the practice that’s conducive…

suttaplex.blurb: The way to uproot all conceivings is to investigate the six sense fields as impermanent, etc.
